Package org.cojen.tupl.ext

Interface TransactionHandler

  • public interface TransactionHandler
    Handler for custom transactional operations. Undo operations are applied to roll back transactions, and redo operations are applied by recovery and replication.
    See Also:
    DatabaseConfig.customTransactionHandler

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void init​(Database db)
      Called once when the database is opened, immediately before recovery is performed.
      void redo​(Transaction txn, byte[] message)
      Called to apply an idempotent redo operation.
      void redo​(Transaction txn, byte[] message, long indexId, byte[] key)
      Called to apply an idempotent redo operation which locked an index key.
      void undo​(byte[] message)
      Called to apply an idempotent undo operation.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        void init​(Database db)
   throws IOException
        Called once when the database is opened, immediately before recovery is performed.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • redo

        void redo​(Transaction txn,
          byte[] message)
   throws IOException
        Called to apply an idempotent redo operation.
        Parameters:
        txn - transaction the operation applies to; can be modified
        message - message originally provided to Transaction.customRedo(byte[], long, byte[])
        Throws:
        IOException

      • redo

        void redo​(Transaction txn,
          byte[] message,
          long indexId,
          byte[] key)
   throws IOException
        Called to apply an idempotent redo operation which locked an index key. The lock ensures that redo operations are ordered with respect to other transactions which locked the same key.
        Parameters:
        txn - transaction the operation applies to; can be modified
        message - message originally provided to Transaction.customRedo(byte[], long, byte[])
        indexId - non-zero index for lock acquisition
        key - non-null key which has been locked exclusively
        Throws:
        IOException

      • undo

        void undo​(byte[] message)
   throws IOException
        Called to apply an idempotent undo operation.
        Parameters:
        message - message originally provided to Transaction.customUndo(byte[])
        Throws:
        IOException
